chunks.lyrics: Received: from ccsg.tau.ac.il (ccsg.tau.ac.il (132.66.16.2)) by post-office.nevada.edu (8.6.4/8.6.4) with SMTP id CAA17296 for ; Fri, 18 Feb 1994 02:11:52 -0800
Ashes are Burning / Michael Dunford, Betty Thatcher (9 pages, 64 lines/page)
Transcribing the entire piece was very difficult, and I am inferior Guitar
player, a novice Bassist and an un-experienced Tablature maker, I'm trying
to give you the best I can figure out of this beautiful piece.
So: There are lots of bass tab for several important lines. I also put bits
of guitar tabs in some important places. I hope the timing is not bad.
The guitar solo at the end (by Andy Powell) is impossible for me to tab -
I just don't know all the tabbing standards, and I can't play it myself
(I'm really lousy with my acoustic guitar). The bass lines can be played
on the four lower strings of your guitar. Note the separation of bars, it
might help you. Also, to start studying this piece, you better play it first
along with the record. I'm sure there are some mistakes with the chords and
I'm afraid I can't always figure out those maj7 or dim chords... so any
ideas or corrections are welcome. Enjoy!
New Version!!! My friend, Raviv Reich, took this file back home and checked
it out. He came back with lots of remarks and ideas, and together we sat down
and made this revised edition. I'm sure it won't be the last... I hope I
didn't make the notes too complex - there are so many options of doing things,
and I wrote some of them. There is help about playing it with Capo - it sounds
For convenience the entire song is separated into 20 sections. In each
of these sections you'll find the bass line or specific chords and so on.
This separation is supposed to help things up. If it only messes everything -
better tell me about it. For more convenience, there's a chords summary in
Each bar has time measures. The song's meter is 4/4, and the tabs are
very detailed and with specific timing. just study it for a while, and I
Some basic tablature signs I used:
F/D - means F chords on C root.
on tab: / - slide up to the following note
~ - kinda tremolo... ~6 means a fast 67646 (organ solo only)
Intro: cymbals give the rhythm and then:
2. Repeat sequence, with bass line as follows:
(*) alternative chords: F/D G7/D Bb/D Dm
3. First verse, goes with the same chord/bass line sequence.
Bass: On the last two Dm, slide down from the Bb/D into this line:
D 2-2-----2-2----- ... Bass continues as in the intro, the same
A ---------------- into the the next verse:
Play this section on the top three strings:
E -10-- -9--- -10-- -9--- (*) if you're playing with Capo
B -8--- -8--- -8--- -8--- better leave D string open
8. Annie goes "La La La" over these chords:
Piano, Guitar & Bass riff over these chords:
10. Then there's a Bass riff: (Bass is Flanged, I think)
11. Now repeat three times, adding Piano, Harpsichords in unison and drums:
Bass: 1 a 2 a 3 a 4 a 1 a 2 a 3 a 4 a
12. Bass riff remains the same as Piano/Harpsichord play.
There are two sequences in this section:
Seq. 1: Am Am6 Am7 Am6Am Am Am6 Am7 Am6Am
Seq. 2: Am sus4 sus4 sus4 sus4
Play the sequences in the following order (after the unison part):
2. Piano playing high chords - repeat seq. 1 twice
4. Piano playing high chords - repeat seq. 2 twice
6. Harpsichord playing low + Piano - repeat seq. 1 twice
7. Harpsichord + High piano. - repeat seq. 2 twice
14. Before the Organ solo starts, Piano plays:
on the G* all instruments play in unison:
Organ Solo - Transcribed for guitar (it works!)
16. After the Organ solo there's a piano solo at almost the same chords:
The F# fades away while long Em chords from organ: This is intro for the
Organ Intro: Em Em/D C C (*) Em/D: x-x-0-0-0-0
Em Em/D C C or: Em7: 0-2-0-0-3-0
Guitar Riff over the Em/D chord:
The sequence goes on till fade. Guitar solo is not here (Hey - give
me a break!), But the heavy bass line is something like this:
I guess this is all... Have fun - and tell me about it... It encourages me
3. F/D G7/D Bb/D Dm Travel the days... Road leading...
F/D G7/D Bb/D Dm Come with me now and show how you...
F/D G7/D Bb/D Dm Follow the dying... Cross all the...
F/D G7/D Bb/D Dm Dm Breath of the... The earths yesterday
4. G D Em D Clear your mind... That the past is...
G D Em Circles away, echo yesterday, Ashes...
5. F/D G7/D Bb/D Dm Colours are fading... Silver the...
F/D G7/D Bb/D Dm Walking the shadows, There in our...
F/D G7/D Bb/D Dm Changing the order... Leaving the...
F/D G7/D Bb/D Dm Dm Fingers are holding fragments of mine
6. G D Em D Clear your mind... That the past is...
G D Em Circles away, echo yesterday, Ashes...
8. G G+11 G G+11 La la la...
C D D C C D D
11. nc nc nc nc nc nc - Unison section
15. Bm Bm G G* Bm Bm G G Bm Bm G G - Organ solo
18. Em Em/D C C Em Em/D C C
19. Em Em/D C C Imagine the burning embers
Em Em/D C C They glow below and above
Em Em/D C C6 Your sins you won't remember
Am Am Em Em/D C C And all you find there is love
Em Em/D C C Ashes are burning brightly
Em Em/D C C The smoke can be seen from afar
Em Em/D C C6 So now your seeing how far
Am Am Em Em/D C C Ashes are burning the way
Am Am Em Em/D C C Ashes are burning the way
20. Em Em/D C C - Repeat till fade.
